metadata.title: CVE-2017-14610 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: bareos-dir, bareos-fd, and bareos-sd in bareos-core in Bareos 16.2.6 andearlier create a PID file after dropping privileges to a non-root account,which might allow local users to kill arbitrary processes by leveragingaccess to this non-root account for PID file modification before a rootscript executes a "kill `cat /pathname`" command.

criterions.comment: bareos: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
